name: squat
title: Squat
description:
Squats are a foundational lower-body exercise that build strength in your quads, glutes, hamstrings, and core.
They also improve balance and coordination.
To perform a proper squat:
1. stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
2. Engage your core, keep your chest upright, and push your hips back as if sitting into a chair.
3. Lower down until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor (or as low as your mobility allows),
4. Keep your knees in line with your toes.
5. Drive through your heels to stand back up.
6. Keep your spine neutral throughout and avoid letting your knees cave inward.

name: pushup
title: Push-Up
description:
Push-ups are a classic bodyweight move that target the chest, shoulders, triceps, and core.
To perform a proper push-up:
1. Begin in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows at about a 45-degree angle.
4. Keep your elbows close to your sides and avoid letting your hips sag or pike.
5. Push back up through your palms to return to the starting position.
6. Maintain a tight core and steady breathing for the best form and results.

name: plank
title: Plank
description:
Planks are an isometric core exercise that builds endurance and strengthens your abs, shoulders, and back.
To do a plank:
1. Place your forearms on the ground with your elbows directly beneath your shoulders.
2. Extend your legs behind you and rise onto your toes.
4. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
5. Engage your core, squeeze your glutes, and avoid letting your hips drop or rise too high.
6. Hold this position as long as possible while maintaining steady breathing and proper alignment.

name: burpee
title: Burpee
description:
Burpees are a high-intensity, full-body cardio and strength exercise.
They work your chest, legs, core, and shoulders while boosting your heart rate.
To do a Burpee:
1. Start standing, drop into a squat position, and place your hands on the floor.
2. Kick your feet back into a push-up position.
3. Perform a push-up (optional), then quickly return your feet to the squat position.
4. Jump explosively into the air, reaching your arms overhead.
5. Land softly and immediately go into the next rep.
6. Keep movements fluid and fast for max effectiveness.

name: mountain climber
title: Mountain Climber
description:
Mountain climbers are a full-body cardio exercise that targets the core, shoulders, and legs.
To do a Mountain Climber:
1. Begin in a high plank position with hands under your shoulders and core tight.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest.
3. Quickly switch legs in a running motion while keeping your upper body steady.
4. Move as quickly as you can while keeping proper form and breathing rhythm.
5. Maintain a flat back and avoid letting your hips rise too high or sag.

name: jumping jacks
title: Jumping Jacks
description:
Jumping jacks are a classic cardio warm-up exercise that engages the entire body.
They’re great for improving heart health and coordination.
To do a Jumping Jack:
1. Start with your feet together and hands at your sides.
2. Jump your feet out while simultaneously raising your arms overhead.
3. Return to the starting position.
4. Keep a steady pace.
5. Land softly on your feet, and maintain an upright posture.

name: lunges
title: Lunges
description:
Lunges strengthen the legs and glutes while improving balance and coordination.
To do Lunges:
1. Begin standing tall.
2. Leg forward, and lower your body until both knees form 90-degree angles.
3. Keep your front knee over your ankle and your torso upright.
4. Push off the front foot to return to the starting position, then switch legs.
5. Engage your core for balance and keep your movements controlled and deliberate.

name: crunches
title: Crunches
description:
Crunches are a focused abdominal exercise that primarily works the upper abs.
To do Crunches:
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place your hands behind your head (without pulling) or across your chest.
3. Engage your core and lift your upper back off the ground.
4. Keep your lower back pressed to the floor.
5. Exhale as you rise and inhale as you lower.
6. Avoid using momentum or straining your neck—controlled motion is key.

name: bicycle crunches
title: Bicycle Crunches
description:
Bicycle crunches are one of the most effective ab exercises, targeting both
upper and lower abs along with the obliques.
To do Bicycle Crunches:
1. Lie flat on your back with hands behind your head and knees lifted at 90 degrees.
2. Lift your shoulders off the ground.
3. Twist your torso to bring your right elbow toward your left knee while extending your right leg.
4. Switch sides in a pedaling motion.
5. Keep your core engaged and move with control for maximum impact.

name: tricep dips
title: Tricep Dips
description:
Tricep dips target the back of the arms, specifically the triceps.
To do Tricep Dips:
1. Sit on a bench or sturdy surface.
2. Place your hands beside your hips, and extend your legs forward.
3. Slide your hips off the edge and bend your elbows to lower your body.
4. Keep elbows pointed back.
5. Lower until your arms form a 90-degree angle, then press back up.
6. Keep your back close to the bench and avoid locking out your elbows at the top.

name: high knees
title: High Knees
description:
High knees are a dynamic cardio move that improves endurance and works your legs and core.
To do High Kness:
1. Stand tall and run in place.
2. Bring your knees as high as possible toward your chest while pumping your arms.
3. Keep your core tight, land softly on the balls of your feet, and aim for quick, light steps.
4. Stay upright and drive through the movement with energy and control.

name: side plank
title: Side Plank
description:
Side planks are a powerful isometric core exercise that targets the obliques.
To do Side Plank:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself up on one forearm with elbow under shoulder.
2. Stack your feet and lift your hips off the ground, forming a straight line from head to heels.
3. Keep your core engaged and avoid sagging.
4. Hold the position, then switch sides.
5. For added challenge, raise the top leg or arm.

name: glutebridge
title: Glute Bridge
description:
The glute bridge is a great move to activate the glutes and strengthen the posterior chain.
To do Glute Bridge:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Pause at the top, then lower slowly.
4. Avoid arching your lower back or pushing through your toes—focus on squeezing the glutes throughout.

name: leg raises
title: Leg Raises
description:
Leg raises target the lower abdominal muscles and help build a strong core.
To do Leg Raises:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and hands under your glutes for support.
2. Keeping your legs straight, lift them toward the ceiling until they form a 90-degree angle with your torso.
3. Slowly lower them back down without touching the ground.
4. Engage your core and avoid arching your back to maximize results and protect your spine.
